Carbon dioxide emissions.Description: Burning fossil fuels releases carbon dioxide into the atmosphere, contributing to carbon dioxide emissions.
Deforestation leads to the release of stored carbon dioxide in trees and vegetation, contributing to carbon dioxide emissions.
Certain industrial processes, such as cement production and chemical manufacturing, release carbon dioxide as a byproduct, contributing to carbon dioxide emissions.
Transportation activities, particularly those using fossil fuel-powered vehicles, generate carbon dioxide emissions through the combustion of fuels.
